description: This path is certainly less overgrown than the north-south one. You actually
find yourself able to move relatively quickly through the forest, stopping
only occasionally to hack away an overhanging branch or vine.
8814.name: The Eastern Path

description: The path you are on here runs down a gently sloping hill, to the base of a
beautiful valley below.
8828.name: The Hill

description: The forest begins to surround you as you step into its depths. The path
abruptly turns to the north and you continue.
8855.name: Approaching Mirkwood

description: The path once again divides, this time into northern and southern branches.
To the north an impressive-looking citadel looms over the treetops, while
to the south the trail becomes significantly narrower, and overgrown.
8805.name: Another Junction

description: The path runs past the rubble and up into the foothills of an immense
mountain range. far in the distance looms Firetop Mountain.
8852.name: The Path to Firetop Mountain

description: You reach a bend in the path, where you can head south or east.
8842.name: A Bend in the Path

description: This path runs for some distance toward a huge cave, entrance to which is
restricted by a massive, handsome door that glows with magic. Magnificent
oaks tower high to either side, and everywhere there is light and beauty.
However, intruders are frowned upon here, so be on your guard.
The entrance is directly before you.
8857.name: A Broad Tree-Lined Path

description: Now you've blown it. You've gone and stumbled into the King's Throne Room.
He is seated upon an intricately-carved wooden throne at the end of the hall.
Dour guards glare at you on all sides.
8865.name: The Throne Room of Thrandul

description: You have reached a point where you can proceed either north or west. Your
choice. You still have the feeling you're being watched...
8826.name: A Junction

description: You have entered a rather forlorn section of the forest, littered with dead
and dying trees, plus the occasional corpse. Howls and cries of pain sound
far off to the south.
8850.name: A Desolate Section of the Forest

description: Progress along this narrow, overgrown path is next to impossible, and you
find yourself having to stop several times for a rest. There doesn't seem to
be any quick end to it either.
At this point you may follow a side trail which runs to the east. It seems
to be a little less overgrown.
8811.name: The Southern Trail

description: The passage ends in a dead end, but you see a small rope ladder hanging down
from a nearby oak tree, disappearing in its bushy branches above.
8844.name: A Dead End

description: This path is fairly even and well-used, so going is not as rough as the
previous paths. There is a wide stream to the south.
A broad, tree-lined path runs to the east.
8825.name: A Northern Path

description: The path here is fairly clear and free of vegetation. It actually looks
fairly well-maintained. You think you can hear a distant singing to the
north.
8816.name: The Northern Path

description: You have stumbled into a Sylvan Elf guard post, from which they carefully
watch out for intruding Orcs or Goblins. They dislike strangers in general,
and detest interlopers into their personal areas even more. Expect a violent
reception if there is a guard present...
8810.name: A Guard Post

description: This area serves as a connector for many areas with an Elven or Faerie flavour,
favored areas of the Immortal Yaegar. Tread carefully, and remember to keep
track of where you have been.
--Yaegar
+            {BThis area has been converted and adapted by{x           +
+                             {GRoland{x                               +
+    {Bmodified, debugged (?:) slightly enhanced and balanced by{x     +
+                             {Gjaceks{x                               +
+                   {Bchecked and beta tested by{x                     +
+                             {GQuartz{x                               +
+                                                          {Rjuly'96{x +
You have entered the quasi-magical Elven forest of Mirkwood, populated by
Sylvan Elves and their mysterious allies. Strangers are frowned upon here,
so be on your guard. It is rumored that many different races of Elves actually
inhabit this forest, in various parts and sometimes they are carefully hidden,
away from the prying eyes of strangers.
There is a sign tacked to a tree nearby.
There is a small (Glowing) (Huming) tablet.
8800.name: Entrance to Mirkwood

description: You are in the castle of the Wood Elven King Thranduil. The corridor here
is usually deserted. It would be advisable to keep a low profile, as the
natives are hostile...
8864.name: Inside the Cave

description: In this room the Elves store their foodstuffs and beloved Dorwinion Wine.
A trapdoor in the floor allows access to the river, and it is through here
that the Elves deposit their empty barrels, so that the river may carry
them down to Lake Town.
8861.name: Storage Room

description: This path is fairly even and well-used, so going is not as rough as the
previous paths. There is a wide stream dead ahead.
8823.name: A Northern Path

description: There is a palpable evil in this area that causes you to shiver as you pass
by the blighted vegetation that lines this twisted gray path. The sky can
no longer be seen overhead- instead a canopy of decaying leaves and rotten
branches obscures your view.
At this point the twisting turning path runs sharply downward toward a large
gash in the side of a grey cliff face.
8839.name: An Evil Section of the Forest

description: You have come out of Mirkwood onto a rather dusty trail. At this point you
may proceed east toward some well-cultivated fields, or south and west back
into the forest.
8847.name: A T-Junction

description: You are advancing along a narrow path that runs deep into the forest of
Mirkwood. Giant, ancient trees tower over you to either side, and sweet
songbirds sing in their lofty branches. However, despite this serene scene,
you can't shake the feeling that you're being watched.
8801.name: The Path Through Mirkwood

description: You have come to another junction in the forest. The path to the east runs
through some handsome aspen and pine, but the northern passage is lined by
sickly-looking, dying trees of unidentifiable type.
8834.name: A Broad Junction

description: This path is certainly less overgrown than the north-south one. You actually
find yourself able to move relatively quickly through the forest, stopping
only occasionally to hack away an overhanging branch or vine.
8813.name: The Eastern Path

description: This path is fairly even and well-used, so going is not as rough as the
previous paths.
8832.name: A Northern Path

description: You have reached a point where the path branches, with paths running to the
east and west. A wild animal suddenly howls angrily some distance away, and
you involuntarily jump.
8803.name: A Fork in the Path

description: You are in the castle of the Wood Elven King Thranduil. The corridor here
is usually deserted. It would be advisable to keep a low profile, as the
natives are hostile...
The enchantments here prohibit spellcasting of any form.
8858.name: Inside the Cave

description: You are floating along a river that will carry you back through the forest,
and eventually to Lake Town.
8866.name: The River

description: The northern road bends to the east at this point, allowing you to gaze
upon a wondrous Elven Fortress. Although you are more than a mile away,
it still looms large ahead of you.
8806.name: A Bend in the Road

description: This damp cell is small and cramped, and offers little comfort to its
single inhabitant.
8867.name: A Cell

description: You are walking along a narrow path that runs from the major northern path
through Mirkwood. Up ahead the path ends in a dead end.
8831.name: A Narrow Path

description: Progress along this narrow, overgrown path is next to impossible, and you
find yourself having to stop several times for a rest. There doesn't seem to
be any quick end to it either.
8808.name: The Southern Trail

description: Here, the path bends sharply to the east, heading toward an area of the
forest that is very different from the previous section. A second path
runs to the north.
8845.name: A Bend in the Path

description: The road opens onto an area cleared of trees here, a broad plain dotted with
the occasional hedge or distant farmhouse. There is a marked path running
due east toward the west gate of the distant fortress.
8807.name: Plains

description: This path runs for some distance toward a huge cave, entrance to which is
restricted by a massive, handsome door that glows with magic. Magnificent
oaks tower high to either side, and everywhere there is light and beauty.
However, intruders are frowned upon here, so be on your guard.
8856.name: A Broad Tree-Lined Path

description: This path is fairly even and well-used, so going is not as rough as the
previous paths. There is a broad junction to the north.
8833.name: A Northern Path

description: You have stumbled into a Sylvan Elf guard post, from which they carefully
watch out for intruding Orcs or Goblins. They dislike strangers in general,
and detest interlopers into their personal areas even more. Expect a violent
reception if there is a guard present...
8846.name: A Guard Post

description: The path ends here in a small clearing with a small shallow pool of crystal
clear water. You feel strangely at ease here.
8818.name: The End of the Path

description: This field borders on a neatly-tended area with several small farmhouses and
a small watch-tower near a wide stream.
8848.name: Cultivated Field

description: Progress along this narrow, overgrown path is next to impossible, and you
find yourself having to stop several times for a rest. There doesn't seem to
be any quick end to it either.
You spy a rope ladder ascending to a platform in a nearby tree.
8809.name: The Southern Trail

description: You can proceed east toward the valley from here, or return to the summit
above.
8829.name: The Base of the Hill

description: This path is fairly even and well-used, so going is not as rough as the
previous paths. There is a narrow path to the east.
8830.name: A Northern Path

description: WHAT? After all that exertion, the path ends at a DEAD END??? Ah well, I
guess you had better turn back...
8812.name: A Dead End

description: There is a palpable evil in this area that causes you to shiver as you pass
by the blighted vegetation that lines this twisted gray path. The sky can
no longer be seen overhead- instead a canopy of decaying leaves and rotten
branches obscures your view.
The dying screams of some animal can be heard.
8837.name: An Evil Section of the Forest

description: You reach a bend in the path, where you can head north or west.
8841.name: A Bend in the Path

description: You are standing before the gash in the cliff-face now, wondering whether
you should continue into the inky darkness beyond...
8840.name: The Cliff Face

description: You are floating along a river that will carry you back through the forest,
and eventually to Lake Town.
8863.name: The River

description: The singing is clearly audible here, and it is coming from a well-tended
grove just below you. Dimly visible are all manner of man and beast, and
although they would usually feed upon each other, they all seem to be at
peace.
8819.name: Approaching the Holy Grove

description: This branch of the path widens out after a short distance, and you notice
signs of heavy use, evidently by non-Elves, as Elves do not leave footprints.
The trees are thinner and smaller in this part of the forest, giving the
impression that it has been recently cleared.
8804.name: A Broad Path

description: There is a palpable evil in this area that causes you to shiver as you pass
by the blighted vegetation that lines this twisted gray path. The sky can
no longer be seen overhead- instead a canopy of decaying leaves and rotten
branches obscures your view.
8836.name: An Evil Section of the Forest

description: There is a palpable evil in this area that causes you to shiver as you pass
by the blighted vegetation that lines this twisted gray path. The sky can
no longer be seen overhead- instead a canopy of decaying leaves and rotten
branches obscures your view.
8835.name: An Evil Section of the Forest

description: This stream is too wide and deep to wade across. You'll need a boat or a
spell. Mind you, you could always whip out your rod and start angling :)
8824.name: A Stream

description: You are advancing along a narrow path that runs deep into the forest of
Mirkwood. Giant, ancient trees tower over you to either side, and sweet
songbirds sing in their lofty branches. However, despite this serene scene,
you can't shake the feeling that you're being watched.
8802.name: The Path Through Mirkwood

description: You are floating along a river that will carry you back through the forest,
and eventually to Lake Town.
8862.name: The River

description: The path you are on here runs down a gently sloping hill, to the base of a
beautiful valley below.
8827.name: The Western Path

description: You have stumbled into a Sylvan Elf guard post, from which they carefully
watch out for intruding Orcs or Goblins. They dislike strangers in general,
and detest interlopers into their personal areas even more. Expect a violent
reception if there is a guard present...
8821.name: A Guard Post

description: The path here is fairly clear and free of vegetation. It actually looks
fairly well-maintained. You think you can hear a distant singing to the
north.
Another path runs to the east of here.
8817.name: The Northern Path

description: You are in the castle of the Wood Elven King Thranduil. The corridor here
is usually deserted. It would be advisable to keep a low profile, as the
natives are hostile...
8859.name: Inside the Cave

description: The path once again divides, this time into northern and southern branches.
To the north lies another bend in the trail, while to the south the trail
becomes significantly narrower, and overgrown.
8843.name: A Junction

description: This path is rather overgrown but it is still easily navigable. You fancy
you can see a rope ladder ascending into the brances of a tall oak near the
eastern side of the road.
8820.name: The Western Path

description: You continue for what seems like an eternity, drawing slowly closer to the
distant peak.
8854.name: The Path Continues

description: You have entered a rather forlorn section of the forest, littered with dead
and dying trees, plus the occasional corpse. Howls and cries of pain sound
far off to the south.
To the south is a particularly dark patch of forest.
8851.name: A Desolate Section of the Forest

description: You have stumbled into the guard room! The guards will definitely not
be happy to see you. You fancy you can hear muffled cries for help.
8860.name: A Guard Room

description: You have entered a rather forlorn section of the forest, littered with dead
and dying trees, plus the occasional corpse. Howls and cries of pain sound
far off to the south.
8849.name: A Desolate Section of the Forest

description: The path bends to the north here, running for some distance toward a stream.
8822.name: A Bend to the North

description: You continue for what seems like an eternity, drawing slowly closer to the
distant peak.
8853.name: The Path Continues

description: You have reached a point where the path bends to the north.
8815.name: A Bend in the Path

description: There is a palpable evil in this area that causes you to shiver as you pass
by the blighted vegetation that lines this twisted gray path. The sky can
no longer be seen overhead- instead a canopy of decaying leaves and rotten
branches obscures your view.
Maggots crawl from a decaying Elven corpse hanging from an overhead branch.
The stench is unbearable.
To the north you see a shadowy area of the forest.
8838.name: An Evil Section of the Forest

description: This path runs more or less directly north toward a rather old-looking
section of the woods.
8868.name: A Northern Path

description:
The Sylvan Elves are a good people, but centuries of subjection to the
violences and prejudices of other races have made them wary and very
hostile toward outsiders. However, if you're tough enough, perhaps he'll
back down. As natives of Mirkwood, they are virtually imposssible to see
if they don't want to be seen.
8800.room_name: A Sylvan Elf scout is offended at your intrusion!
8800.name: a sylvan elf scout~

description:
The Sylvan Elves are a good people, but centuries of subjection to the
violences and prejudices of other races have made them wary and very
hostile toward outsiders. However, if you're tough enough, perhaps he'll
back down.
8801.room_name: A Sylvan Elf warrior lunges at you with his sword!
8801.name: a sylvan elf warrior~

description:
These foul creatures have been sent in advance by Orcish forces to scout
out the defenses of Mirkwood. So far, their attempts have resulted only
in their own demise, but eventually the Elves will be worn down by the
sheer weight of numbers of the immense Orcish hordes.
8802.room_name: An Orcish scout screams and attacks!
8802.name: an orc scout~

description:
These fell minions of Sauron have been sent in an attempt to subjugate
Mirkwood. So far, their attempts have resulted only in their own demise,
but eventually the Elves will be worn down by the sheer weight of numbers 
of the immense Orcish hordes.
8803.room_name: An Orcish warrior screams and attacks!
8803.name: an orc warrior~

description:
This angry guard is incensed at your trespass in the hall of his king, and
will attempt to forcibly eject you.
8804.room_name: A Wood Elf guard angrily accosts you.
8804.name: a wood elf guard~

description:
The Wood Elves are a good people, but centuries of subjection to the
violences and prejudices of other races have made them wary and very
hostile toward outsiders. However, if you're tough enough, perhaps he'll
back down.
8805.room_name: A Wood Elf chief of the guard lunges at you with his sword!
8805.name: the chief of the guard~

description:
Galion has a tremenous fondness for Dorwinion Wine, and he is now well and
truly inebriated. However that does not mean he won't react to your intrusion.
8806.room_name: A Wood Elf butler glares at you accusingly.
8806.name: Galion the butler~

description:
While not immune to the prejudices of his brethren, Thranduil is a trifle
wiser (and more civilized) and he will not attack without provocation.
8807.room_name: Thranduil, King of the Wood Elves, eyes you suspiciously.
8807.name: Thranduil, king of the Wood Elves~

description:
This person won't attack you like the guards will, but that doesn't mean
he likes you any more than they do...
8808.room_name: A male Wood Elf glares angrily at you.
8808.name: a male wood elf~

description:
This person won't attack you like the guards will, but that doesn't mean
ahe likes you any more than they do...
8809.room_name: A female Wood Elf glares angrily at you.
8809.name: a female wood elf~

description: This surly fellow is almost always passed out from copious alcohol consumption.
8810.name: the turnkey~

description:
This Dwarf is descended from noble blood. He and his fellows were waylaid
by the Wood Elves while journeying to avenge their brethren against the
dragon Smaug.
8811.room_name: Thorin Oakenshield politely bows before you.
8811.name: Thorin Oakenshield~
